titles.title: Children's Television Advertising Practices Act of 1988
A bill to require the Federal Communications Commission to reinstate restrictions on advertising during children's television, and for other purposes.

action.text: Read twice and referred to the Committee on Commerce.

bill.summary: 2/18/1988--Introduced. Children's Television Advertising Practices Act of 1988 - Requires the Federal Communications Commission to prescribe standards for commercial television broadcast licensees with respect to advertising in programs for children. Requires the standards to: (1) limit the duration of advertising to a specified number of minutes per hour; (2) assure adequate separation between program content and commercial messages; and (3) eliminate the use of program characters to promote products. Directs the FCC to initiate rulemaking proceedings in conjunction with these standards within ten days of this Act's enactment and to promulgate the final standards within 120 days of the enactment date.
